intro: Chamaemelum chamomilla, commonly known as German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its leaves are finely dissected and have a characteristic apple-like scent, while the flowers are used in herbal medicine and teas. Chamaemelum chamomilla is known for its calming properties and is often used to treat digestive issues and promote relaxation.
